column1: Parts of a human skeleton were found north of Vero in association with the remains of Pleistocene animals in 1915. The find was controversial
column2: and the view that the human remains dated from much later than the Pleistocene prevailed for many years. In 2006
column3: an image of a mastodon or mammoth carved on a bone was found in vicinity of the Vero man discovery. A scientific forensic examination of the bone found the carving had probably been done in the Pleistocene. Archaeologists from Mercyhurst University
column4: in conjunction with the Old Vero Ice Age Sites Committee (OVIASC)
column5: conducted excavations at the Old Vero Man site in Vero Beach in 2014–15. Starting in 2016
column6: archaeologists from Florida Atlantic University joined the Old Vero Man site excavations.

column2: a Spanish treasure fleet wrecked off the coast of Vero. Eleven out of twelve Spanish ships carrying tonnes of silver foundered in a hurricane. The remains of the silver attracted pirates. A group of 300 unemployed English privateers led by Henry Jennings stole about £87
column3: 500 in gold and silver in their first acts of piracy.

column1: In 1872 Captain Allen W. Estes officially established the first land patent between the Atlantic Ocean and the Indian River Lagoon
column2: after settling in the area in 1870.

column1: In 1893 Henry Flagler’s Florida East Coast Railway began operation through the area.The town of Vero was chartered on June 13
column2: 1919.Vero was officially renamed "Vero Beach" and was switched from being part of St. Lucie County to become the county seat of Indian River County when it was formed in June
column3: 1925. There are many theories on possible origin of the city name
column4: but there's no consensus.During the war year of 1942 the U.S. Navy selected 1

column6: a Naval Air Station. Due to the bombing practices conducted during the WWII
column7: there are many buried explosives and the Army Corps officials have conducted ongoing search & clearing exercises for the potentially dangerous items since 2014.In 1951 Barber Bridge was built from mainland to barrier islands. It was later demolished and replaced in 1995 with the Merrill P. Barber Bridge. It is named after Merrill P. Barber who was the mayor of Vero beach in 1947.In 1957 Piper Aircraft began research and development in Vero Beach. In 1961 Piper Aircraft moved administrative and manufacturing operations to Vero after completing building additions.In 1965 the A1A bridge over the Sebastian Inlet connected the two barrier islands. column1: Vero Beach has a humid subtropical climate

column3: sunny
column4: and dry winters. The average annual temperature is 72.7 °F
column5: with an annual high temperature of 81.4 °F and an annual low temperature of 64 °F. On average Vero Beach is frost free.

column1: Vero Beach is home to Historic Dodgertown
column2: which initially started operations during World War II as a U.S. Naval Air Station
column3: and later served as the Spring Training facility of the Los Angeles Dodgers baseball team
column4: until 2008. After the team's departure for a new Spring home in Arizona in 2008
column5: it has served as a year-round multi-purpose facility for athletes of all ages. As of January 2
column7: MLB has assumed control of the historic facilities with plans to expand the complex and rename it The Jackie Robinson Training Complex. This is to honor both the late Jackie Robinson and the site's history as the first racially integrated spring-training center in the American South.
